column1: Art Institute of Chicago////Soon Bertha and Potter Palmer had the most comprehensive collection of late 19th Century French anti-establishment Paintings on Earth. And when the 1893 Columbia Exhibition came to Chicago (AKA: the 1893 World's Fair)
column2: Bertha Palmer and other Chicago art collectors and philanthropists raced to build and stock The Chicago Academy of Fine Arts (later named The Art Institute of Chicago)
column3: on Michigan Avenue (its present location). Palmer donated her collection to the museum as did many other wealthy Chicago collectors
column4: like Charles Hutchinson (who also headed up the University of Chicago)
